creator: jfinn@printeron.net
text:
On some of my servers, the following error message displays several times per 
second:

[Fri Feb 21 00:03:10 2003] [warn] (OS 64)The specified network name is no 
longer available.  : winnt_accept: Asynchronous AcceptEx failed.

The performance of the server does not seem to be affected by this, however it 
is annoying and does not happen on all of my servers.

The Apache install on these servers is from a compiled Apache with SSL support 
using OpenSSL-0.9.6h.

Out of 4 servers, this happens on 2. The only major difference that exists 
between the servers is that the 2 that are not giving the error are using 
Win2K Server and the 2 with errors are using Win2K Pro.

All boxes are running SP3, and have the same system services enabled or 
disabled.

creator: jfinn@printeron.net
text:
I should also mention that the error appears in the log several times per 
minute regardless of whether someone is hitting the server or not. Just 
starting the daemon starts the errors appearing in the log.

creator: carl@voodoomedia.co.uk
text:
Yes got exactly same problem here on Windows 2000/SP3 with Apache 2.0.44 with 
PHP4.3.1 installed and no SSL support. Only thing I could think of is that 
ServerName directive isn't the same as the acual machine name but that really 
shouldnt make a difference. 

Apache 1.3.7 works 100% on the same machine

I have the strong feeling that it's the winsock2 that causes problems. (I'd
guess, the server version is better maintained). Future versions of apache
(starting with 2.1, don't know whether it will be backported) will provide a
directive to workaround that problem (by not using AcceptEx).

Not so helpful at the moment, I know ... Changing status to "Later"
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Just a follow up, I have now seen this but on a Win2K Server. Up until now I 
had only experienced it on Workstation.

This is with a compiled version of Apache 2.0.45, OpenSSL 0.9.7b
creator: jfinn@printeron.net
